DataElement.preferredDefinition: The interval between the activities of a biospecimen represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Events Domain Biospecimen Activity Elapsed Time
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._The interval between two reference points in time.
